intro: Lastrea sancta, commonly known as the sacred fig or holy fig, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries that are edible. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its cultural significance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
